Reference

Layouts

Setup gridlayout containers

grid_page()

Use gridlayout for entire app layout

grid_container()

gridlayout container for use within other elements

use_gridlayout_rmd()

Enable gridlayout usage in RMarkdown documents

Content containers

Place content on the grid.

grid_card()

Grid-positioned card element

grid_card_old()

Grid-positioned card element - old version

grid_card_plot()

Grid-positioned plot output

grid_card_text()

Grid-positioned card with only text

grid_nested()

Grid-positioned card with gridlayout positioned content

card_plot_output()

Plot output with smart sizing for use inside a grid_card - Depreciated

grid_place()

Place any shiny.tag element on the grid

Working with gridlayout objects

Functions for creating, editing, or generating content with gridlayout objects. For advanced use-cases.

new_gridlayout()

Construct a gridlayout object

md_to_gridlayout()

Build gridlayout object from markdown table

get_elements()

Get elements and positions out of a gridlayout object

get_element_ids()

Get ids of element in gridlayout object

to_md()

Convert gridlayout to markdown table

to_matrix()

Convert gridlayout to matrix format

to_css()

Generate dynamic css for a given gridlayout

Contents

gridlayout is built for R Markdown, an ecosystem of packages for creating computational documents in R. Learn more at rmarkdown.rstudio.com.

Site built with pkgdown 2.0.7.
